On 9/18/06, isowitz <isowitz@...> wrote:
> I have a short question. Is it good to make a assertTrue(), assertEquals
> () etc. in the setUp() or tearDown() methode?

Short answer: No.

Medium answer: The setUp() and tearDown() methods are convenience
methods provided to allow creation and removal of test scaffolding on
a "per test" basis. If you are uncertain that something is going to
return a reliable value, then perhaps that's a sign that it should be
the subject of a test rather than used to do the testing? The code in
the setUp() or tearDown() methods needs to be as rock solid as you can
manage, otherwise it may well introduce unexpected variableness into
your testing.

I'll leave the long answers to others on the list. :-)

Simon
